meanings.definition: To rise or swell in a dome-like shape.
meanings.sent1: The dough started updoming in the oven.
meanings.sent2: The mountain updomed majestically against the sky.
meanings.sent3: The balloon was updoming so fast, it looked like it might pop!
meanings.sent4: Her excitement updomed as she reached the peak of the roller coaster.
meanings.sent5: The hot air balloon updoming above the fields was a breathtaking sight.

meanings.definition: The act of forming a dome shape upwards.
meanings.sent1: The updoming of the cake made it look like a mini mountain.
meanings.sent2: The architect's design included the updoming of the central tower.
meanings.sent3: The updoming of the jelly on the plate amused the children.
meanings.sent4: The updoming of the clouds signaled an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The updoming of the igloo's roof was a marvel of engineering.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming domed or rounded on top.
meanings.sent1: The updoming of the hill provided a scenic view of the valley.
meanings.sent2: The updoming of the turtle shell offered protection from predators.
meanings.sent3: The updoming of the muffin top made it irresistible to eat.
meanings.sent4: The updoming of the waves indicated a strong undercurrent.
meanings.sent5: The updoming of the snow on the mountain peak sparkled in the sunlight.
